member.name: M:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.name: F:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.AuthenticationConfiguration.ResourceServerEncryptionPrivateKey
member.summary: The FOR SAMPLE ONLY hard-coded private key used to decrypt access tokens intended for this resource server.
member.remarks: In a real app, the resource server would likely use its own HTTPS certificate or some other certificate stored securely on the server rather than hard-coded in compiled code for security and ease of changing the certificate in case it was compromised.

member.name: F:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.AuthenticationConfiguration.AuthorizationServerSigningPublicKey
member.summary: The FOR SAMPLE ONLY hard-coded public key of the authorization server that is used to verify the signature on access tokens.
member.remarks: In a real app, the authorization server public key would likely come from the server's HTTPS certificate, but in any case would be determined by the authorization server and its policies. The hard-coded value used here is so this sample works well with the OAuthAuthorizationServer sample, which has the corresponding sample private key.

member.name: T:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.Client
member.summary: An OAuth 2.0 Client that has registered with this Authorization Server.

member.name: P:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.Client.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth2#IClientDescription#DefaultCallback
member.summary: Gets the callback to use when an individual authorization request does not include an explicit callback URI.
member.value: An absolute URL; or null if none is registered.

member.name: P:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.Client.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth2#IClientDescription#ClientType
member.summary: Gets the type of the client.

member.name: P:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.Client.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth2#IClientDescription#HasNonEmptySecret
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a non-empty secret is registered for this client.

member.name: M:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.Client.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth2#IClientDescription#IsCallbackAllowed(System.Uri)
member.summary: Determines whether a callback URI included in a client's authorization request is among those allowed callbacks for the registered client.
member.param: The absolute URI the client has requested the authorization result be received at.
member.returns: true if the callback URL is allowable for this client; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.Client.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth2#IClientDescription#IsValidClientSecret(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified client secret is correct.
member.param: The secret obtained from the client.
member.returns: true if the secret matches the one in the authorization server's record for the client; false otherwise.
member.remarks: All string equality checks, whether checking secrets or their hashes, should be done using to mitigate timing attacks.

member.name: T:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.DatabaseKeyNonceStore
member.summary: A database-persisted nonce store.

member.name: M:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.DatabaseKeyNonceStore.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.DatabaseKeyNonceStore.StoreNonce(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Stores a given nonce and timestamp.
member.param: The context, or namespace, within which the must be unique. The context SHOULD be treated as case-sensitive. The value will never be null but may be the empty string.
The UTC timestamp that together with the nonce string make it unique within the given . The timestamp may also be used by the data store to clear out old nonces.
member.returns: True if the context+nonce+timestamp (combination) was not previously in the database. False if the nonce was stored previously with the same timestamp and context.
member.remarks: The nonce must be stored for no less than the maximum time window a message may be processed within before being discarded as an expired message. This maximum message age can be looked up via the property.

member.name: M:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.OAuth2AuthorizationServer.CreateAuthorizationServerSigningKey
member.summary: Creates the RSA key used by all the crypto service provider instances we create.
member.returns: RSA data that includes the private key.

member.name: M:BT.TS360API.WebAPI.OAuth.Utilities.AsUtc(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Ensures that local times are converted to UTC times. Unspecified kinds are recast to UTC with no conversion.
